text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Friday.
- We shall not be building nuclear power plants, claims the Croatian government.
- Is Croatia to become a Council of Europe member as of November 7?
- Why has the debate on the raising of Radio 101 equity been postponed?
- Is the Krsko nuclear power plant to be closed down due to lack of finances enabling replacement of old steam generators?
- Some 6,000 small shareholders expected to buy into shipper Croatia Line valued at 257 million German marks.
- Feral Tribune journalists acquitted, following charges they had slandered the Croatian president.
- U.N. Transitional Administration in Eastern Slavonia pleased with the General Amnesty Law adopted by the Croatian Parliament, says spokesperson Philip Arnold.
- A member of Serb paramilitaries gives himself up to the Knin police more than a year after Operation Storm. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
